editing (academic) | Shillingsburg_1996

academic editing (this for a lack of a better distinguising name, or perhaps for lack of a more distinguished name) is the term I use for the work of an “editor” asked by a publisher to write an introduction for a reprint, said editor not necessarily taking part in the selection, correction, or proofreading of the new “edition”.
